subtasks: Steer the tractor toward the field.
Adjust the attachment on the tractor to the proper height.
Guide the attachment over the rows of the field.
Ensure the attachment is functioning correctly as it passes through the soil.

tasks.task: Using a sharp implement to break up the soil.
subtasks: Position the sharp implement under the field surface.
Lift the implement to the desired depth to disrupt the soil structure.
Monitor the break-up process to ensure thorough coverage.

tasks.task: Operating a sprayer to apply chemicals.
subtasks: Load the sprayer with the appropriate chemical.
Calibrate the sprayer for the correct application rate.
Drive the tractor with the sprayer attachments through the field.
Overlap the application paths slightly to ensure full coverage.
Survey the grazing area to assess the available pasture.
Ensure the pasture is clear of debris and safe for livestock.
Introduce the livestock into the pasture.
Monitor the livestock's behavior and adjust the grazing area as needed.
Inspect the tractor for any visible damages or issues.
Lubricate moving parts of the tractor and its attachments.
Check the fluid levels and tighten any loose connections.
Store the equipment properly to prevent wear and tear.
